pullRequest.body:
This is not exhaustive. Add some `inherit_doc` when appropriate.

---

Commits can be reviewed separately.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [b76c60e824](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20684/commits/b76c60e8244bc27af19e72db4e0aac50a5b308ed)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (17.00, 0.03)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|648|-17|documentation nolint entries|

Current commit [b76c60e824](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/b76c60e8244bc27af19e72db4e0aac50a5b308ed)
Reference commit [8f355f5e88](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/8f355f5e88923a65fc6ea15daa7f110406ed00ed)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@j-loreaux This performs some of the menial task you asked me to on #11905. Would you like to review (part of) this PR?
bors delegate+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Thanks for the review! I have audited all occurrences (on a long train ride); this should be good to go now.

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12960239771/job/36153793455)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12960239771/job/36153793327)

Looks to good to me. 

Two larger points for the future:
- a `@[scoped NS]` attribute might be appealing cosmetically 
- rarely do I read a math paper that says "Notation is...". It is almost always "denoted as ..."

Looks to good to me. 

Two larger points for the future:
- a `@[scoped NS]` attribute might be appealing cosmetically 
- rarely do I read a math paper that says "Notation is...". It is almost always "denoted as ..."
Is there notation for this definition?
Indeed not, good catch! Reverted.

```suggestion
@[inherit_doc kroneckerTMul] 
scoped[Kronecker] notation:100 x " ‚äó‚Çñ‚Çú[" R "] " y:100 => Matrix.kroneckerMap (TensorProduct.tmul R) x y
```
This one seems strange on its face. Can you double check?
This notation is defined in `Geometry/Manifold/ChartedSpace.lean`. I'm not sure if this is the best solution; I could also simply add a comment there.
For my laziness, can you point me to where this is
Similarly: in `Geometry/Manifold/ChartedSpace.lean`

```suggestion
@[inherit_doc kroneckerTMul] scoped[Kronecker] notation:100 x " ‚äó‚Çñ‚Çú[" R "] " y:100 => 
  Matrix.kroneckerMap (TensorProduct.tmul R) x y
```
Odd that it is too long now. Above is a suggestion -- take it or leave it. I don't remember the amount of indentation for line breaks on notation. Returning to what you had before would be ok too.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: ensure `inherit_doc`-ed notation is mentioned in the underlying doc-string
